name: Tomás Svoboda
content: Tomas Svoboda Tomas Svoboda Professor Faculty of Electrical Engineering (vicedean) Department of Cybernetics Vision for Robotics and Autonomous Systems (head) Appointments on request. calendar, not all events are visible. Czech Technical University in Prague, Fac. of Electrical Engineering, Dep. of Cybernetics Center for Machine Perception, Center for Robotics and Autonomous Systems Karlovo namesti 13, 121 35 Prague, Czech Republic Room1: KN:E-226, tel:+420 2 24357448, fax:+420 2 24357385 e-mail: svobodat AT fel.cvut.cz LinkedIn: svobodatomas Hiring I am often looking for strongly motivated PhD as well as undergraduate students. Occasionally, I also have an opening for post-doc positions. If you are interested in what we are doing (check also the VRAS group pages) and want to join us, send me your resume. Teaching A book about (Matlab) programming for Image Processing and Computer Vision. Free codes, demos, links to presentations, etc. Student projects: Open topics: [CS | EN]. Older. Finished theses (not a complete list, many older works are not there). B4B33RPH Solving problems and (other) games. Bachelor course in the study program Open Informatics. [maze video] B3B33KUI Cybernetics and Artificial Intelligence. Introducing students into the search, sequential decisions, reinforcement learning and simple classifiers. Also in English as BE5B33KUI prg.ai Master a computer science master program focused om AI/machine learning. Taught exlusively in English. Co-founder and head of the preparation team. Open Informatics, a computer science program, member of the board. Cybernetics and Robotics, bachelor and master program, member of the board. Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, EECS bachelor program, (2015-2021) head of the board. Hry, Algoritmy, Programovani, a jine hratKY. (Games, Algorithms, Programming, and gaming ...) for (not only) high-school students. past teaching BE5B33PRG Programming Essentials. Introductory programming course for the EECS study program. A4M33MPV Computer Vision Methods. Master course in the study program Open Informatics. XE383ZS Signal and Image Processing. X383ZS in Czech. Demo video. XE33PVR Computer Vision and Virtual Reality. X33KUI Cybernetics and Artificial Intelligence (in Czech) Y33ROV Robotics and Machine Perception (in Czech), demo video. Research Interests, Projects Appoximately in reverse chronological order. You may also check related departmental demos/news, VRAS YouTube channel. Helhest.com A CTU spinoff around autonomous outdoor heavy terrain robots. Resilient machines through continuous learning and sensing, part of project Roboprox-Robotics and advanced industrial production. Vacant positions! Search and Rescue. Our CTU-CRAS team qualified to DARPA SubT (#subtchallenge). We won the prize at the Tunnel Circuit and at the Urban Circuit. Research Center for Informatics, RCI. perception for automotive, H2020 project Enable-S3. Public event Dublin 2018/06 video. vision for aerial robots, participating on MBZIRC. Rescue robotics. Vision for outdoor rescue robots (UGV), Eurathlon/TRADR summer school, European (EU) projects TRADR, Nifti, CMP demos, NIFTi robot in Czech TV Advanced predictors for object detection and tracking. Learning for tracking and recognition. Multicamera environments, Virtual Rooms. See also ViRoom, Blue-C. (Multi-)Camera (self-)calibration. Free SW downloadable Omnidirectional vision; Omnivis2004, The fifth Workshop on Omnidirectional Vision, Camera Networks and Non-classical cameras, In conjunction with ECCV2004. Selected publications Public profiles (as requested by area chairs of CVPR2012, and many others ...)
